sentences.sContent: The movie was a great success.
The news came as possibly the greatest shock of my life.
sentences.sCn: 这个消息可能是我一生中最大的打击。

sentences.sContent: The paintings cost a great deal (= a lot ) of money.
John always takes great care over his work.
sentences.sCn: 约翰工作时总是非常小心。

sentences.sContent: It’s a great pity that none of his poems survive.
sentences.sCn: 非常遗憾，他的诗歌没有一首保存下来。

sentences.sContent: The temptation was too great to resist.
one of the greatest scientific achievements of our time
sentences.sCn: 我们这个时代最伟大的科学成就之一

sentences.sContent: ...people like Veiseh are of great interest to neuroscientists hoping to understand the way the brain records our lives...
...Small signs may indicate great changes to come and therefore merit attention...
...letting go of the safety and security of the past gives us great fear...
...introduction of American great writers and some excepts from great works like the Old man and the Sea by Hemingway...
...In order to appreciate the magnificence of this great mountain...
...People and homes are showing great change as more and more unique handcrafted items become available...
...It's great to build a memory for them too...
...It’s great because we play cards or just sit around and talk when there are no customers...
...and could be a great way to connect with academic and professional resources at your university...
...The initiative will help states and school districts support great educators for the students who need them most...

synos.tran: 伟大的，重大的；极好的，好的；主要的

phrases.pCn: 万里长城；中国长城计算机集团公司
有着重要意义，十分重要
大萧条（美国经济大萧条时期）
大量的；许多的；大部分的

trans.tranOther: very large in amount or degree
